comments.text:
+Goldtube yah I've heard/read that many times. Well, if a girl makes the 
choice to go with the norms of her culture then she has no right to 
complain if she turns 29 or 30 and is still single.
Islams laws are laws of hikmah(wisdom). The prophet peace be upon him came 
to teach us hikmah. So if you dont act on the teachings of Islam you are 
going against hikmah, and you will experience failure in everything you do.
There are several examples in the life of the prophet peace be upon him, 
and the sahaba where it was the woman who proposed to the man, the most 
famous of them being that of Khadeeja, who is one of the 4 greatest women 
ever.
This is hikmah. This is wisdom. If you choose not to follow it, then youll 
have only yourself to blame for your misery many years later.

comments.text:
Tie your camel and then put your trust in Allah (ie. strive to attain what 
you want and THEN put trust in Allah).
If you just sit at home and wait for a man to come and propose to you, 
youll have only yourself to blame if you "expire".
Sunnah doesnt stop a woman from proposing to a man she likes. Khadija, 1 of 
the 4 greatest women ever, did it.
So learn the sharia and apply it in your life and abandon man-made baseless 
cultural norms.
May Allah guide all of us that which pleases Him, Ameen!
comments.author: ThatPakiGuy

comments.text:
You are not expiring soon, death is your only expiration, as well as those 
who act dead when they are alive. Your parents cannot deny you your 
God-given rights. If your father will not get you married, then you can ask 
 your next nearest wali to help you, such as your father's brother, or your 
own brother if he is an adult and capable.
Meanwhile study, do something with your life and do not waste it waiting 
for a man. Today a marriage can be the end of one's life, so make something 
of yourself with the time and the youth that you have been blessed with and 
continue praying to Allah and trying to have conversations with ur parents.

captions.text: Asalaamu alaikum
Marriage (english), Shaadi (urdu), Biya (punjabi)
Itís a sunnah, and if its not done it can lead to haraam relationships
And looking at bad things.
You know what Iím talking about. Yeah you!
Donít look behind, thereís no one behind you. Hang your head in shame.
So for a practicing brother or sister how do you go about getting married
Well, first thing you do. Approach your parents
Tell them, have a conversation with them.
Oh, but they donít understand me. Nonsense!
Speak with them and youíll be surprised.
Number 2. Make dua. You canít do something as big as this
Without asking Allah subhanahu wata ala
And number 3, perfect yourself, work on yourself,
Get rid of your bad habits.
With that being said, hereís a few things married brothers say:
You know what Iím taking about.
You donít know what Iím talking about,
alright then watch this then, yeah. Youíll understand donít worry.
Bro. Yeah, whats up man. I need to get married man. Alright.
Brother, am I not married because Iím ugly.
No bro youíre alright. Thanks.
Youíre doing the red one yeah. Oo you missed, my turn.
No more samosa, hmmm yeah.
Make dua that I get married.
AlrightÖfish.
Bro (x3). Yeah!
You know getting married once completes half your deen
So if you were to get married twice does that complete your entire deen.
Have you been sniffing petrol again.
Naa bro, I donít do that, anymore.
Brother, did you say you had a sister?
Yeah sheís 2. But I got a brother heís the same age as you.
Donít worry brother, one day inshaAllah. One day.
Hey (x3) look on the bright side, not being married gives you more time to
Learn from married couples and their mistakes
Learn the deen and become a better person
Doing dawah projects which would not be possible if you were married.
Number one, because youíre not ready yet.
Allah wants you to learn a few things before you get married.
Number 2, Allah wants you to accomplish certain things before tying the knot.
Not the one with the string, I mean marriage.
And number 3, to save you from any heartache.
Ooo what do you mean heartache.
Imagine if you were to get married straight away.
You wouldnít really appreciate the need for a partner
and how life sucks without them.
And number 2, imagine the pain if you were to get married, have a kid,
Then get divorced, then the case goes to court.
After all of that youíll end up heartbroken
Many people donít get want to get married after that.
So to save you from all of that, Allah is just saying ìwaitî
So whatís the conclusion brothers?
Thereís a 3 step process.
1) You speak to your parents, you communicate with them
2) You make dua, you ask Allah.
And number 3 you work on yourself, you perfect yourself
Make yourself ready for marriage.
Hopefully that was short, sweet and to the point.
Until next time, Asalaamu alaikum.
Brother did you say you had a sister.
No man my sisterís 2. But I got a brother heís the same age asÖ
Why did you laughÖ it was funny when I said it.
Are you listening to me? What, who are you?
Make dua that I get married.
OK, OK, it will happen inshaAllah.
Mmmm, fish.
Donít worry brother, one day inshaallah. One day.
You donít want any food do you?
Ooo you missed, my turn. I win... what are we going next?
Smile to JannahÖsee ya.
Jazakallah khair for watching this video, if you liked it,
Donít forget to like, comment and subscribe
Iíve said this so many times but some of you still donít do it
Who do you think you are? Oooh, well Iím waiting, come/welcome/marhaba
No Iím just joking, if you come weíll probably sit down and have tea or something.
